title: Rate-limit bypass

profile.name: Slack
profile.about: All your team communication in one place, instantly searchable, and available wherever you go.

vulnerability_information:
Hello Slack,

This vulnerability is about a 2FA Bypass, On Slack Web Application there is rate limit implemented. After performing 4-6 failed 2FA Attempt, Rate limit logic will ge Triaged and ask user to wait for next attempt(preventing automated 2FA Attempts)

I tested the same using iOS App(iOS 9.3.3 iPad Air 2) and found that API Endpoint "/api/auth.signin" have no rate limit implemented.

Due to this an attacker can brute force the 2FA Valid Code to get into user(Victim`s account)
Vulnerable Endpoint - /api/auth.signin
Vulnerable Parameter = pin

Re-Production
I created the POC Video in 2 parts, Because creating this POC in singe Video will make a large size of video file.

POC Video Part 1 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZCOii-HIr4A
POC Video Part 2 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d1dknJXCPy4

* Screen shot is also attached.

1) Using Slack iOS App, Sign into an account in which 2FA is enabled.
2) Intercept the 2FA enter code request and perform many numbers of attempts( In my POC i had performed 100 attempts, Due to size of POC Video) But you can perform as more as you can.
3) In attack windows you will see that all invalid code attempt came as same response code response message of "invalid_pin" but our valid code will came as different response length code response message like "{"ok":true,"token":"xoxs-62548102116-65394751110-76166043750-0a50252718","user":"U1XBLN338","team":"T1UG4303E"}"

If there was a rate limit implemented than i should get block after 4-6 failed just like Slack Web Application. 

Thanks
Narendra
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello Slack,

This vulnerability is about a 2FA Bypass, On Slack Web Application there is rate limit implemented. After performing 4-6 failed 2FA Attempt, Rate limit logic will ge Triaged and ask user to wait for next attempt(preventing automated 2FA Attempts)

I tested the same using iOS App(iOS 9.3.3 iPad Air 2) and found that API Endpoint "/api/auth.signin" have no rate limit implemented.

Due to this an attacker can brute force the 2FA Valid Code to get into user(Victim`s account)
Vulnerable Endpoint - /api/auth.signin
Vulnerable Parameter = pin

Re-Production
I created the POC Video in 2 parts, Because creating this POC in singe Video will make a large size of video file.

POC Video Part 1 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZCOii-HIr4A
POC Video Part 2 - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d1dknJXCPy4

  • Screen shot is also attached.

1) Using Slack iOS App, Sign into an account in which 2FA is enabled.
2) Intercept the 2FA enter code request and perform many numbers of attempts( In my POC i had performed 100 attempts, Due to size of POC Video) But you can perform as more as you can.
3) In attack windows you will see that all invalid code attempt came as same response code response message of "invalid_pin" but our valid code will came as different response length code response message like "{"ok":true,"token":"xoxs-62548102116-65394751110-76166043750-0a50252718","user":"U1XBLN338","team":"T1UG4303E"}"

If there was a rate limit implemented than i should get block after 4-6 failed just like Slack Web Application.

Thanks
Narendra

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

In my tests, it appears that I was actually silently rate limited when performing a brute force of this endpoint.  In your video, the number of requests, and the rate at which you can make those requests is throttled by Burp Suite itself in the free version.  Remember, an attacker would likely need to try tens of thousands of requests to find the proper code (you tried only 100), and these must be performed very quickly before the code expires.  In my tests, I searched through 1000 codes in less than 2 minutes and even when I hit the correct code, the response was still "invalid pin".  I suspect that in your tests, you aren't sending requests fast enough or perhaps, not sending enough total requests to trigger the rate limiting on this endpoint.  If you still feel that there exists no rate limiting at all on this endpoint, we would appreciate it if you would provide additional evidence showing a somewhat more realistic attack.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

In my tests, it appears that I was actually silently rate limited when performing a brute force of this endpoint. In your video, the number of requests, and the rate at which you can make those requests is throttled by Burp Suite itself in the free version. Remember, an attacker would likely need to try tens of thousands of requests to find the proper code (you tried only 100), and these must be performed very quickly before the code expires. In my tests, I searched through 1000 codes in less than 2 minutes and even when I hit the correct code, the response was still "invalid pin". I suspect that in your tests, you aren't sending requests fast enough or perhaps, not sending enough total requests to trigger the rate limiting on this endpoint. If you still feel that there exists no rate limiting at all on this endpoint, we would appreciate it if you would provide additional evidence showing a somewhat more realistic attack.

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
@bugtriage-josh You already observed what i am willing to say,

Yes, Burp suite free edition have his own time throttling by default as it is a free version BTW.

You statement is also true that, rate limit will trigger after number of certain attempts in a fastest way, predefine in rate limit logic. I agreed.

But my concern was, Why the rate limit is only depends on number of attempts in a certain time.

E.X.
If the request is more then 300 in 1 minute then rate limit will get trigger otherwise not.
Thats what i am trying to say, That do not depends on only certain number of attempts.

For making of tons of request, We can use 2 or 3 different locations to attack from, Using time throttling request.

Hope it will help.

Hope it will help.

activities.message:
Thank you for your followup

As you mentioned, this endpoint does employ rate limiting to deter this type of attack. While we may tweak these settings, changing the point at which rate limiting occurs, what mechanism is used, etc. if we notice actual abuse, we do not consider this to be a discrete vulnerability (as a complete lack rate limiting might be). As such, this type of defense-in-depth suggestion is not eligible for a bounty via this program.

Thanks, and good luck with you future bug hunting.

activities.message:
@bugtriage-josh I know that, This report is already closed. But i think you should take a look at new details.
POC Video - https://youtu.be/EKB8tNKf8No
Other Details
1) Total Threads=20 ( Without Throttled)
2) Total Request = 1340
3) Valid Code = 938665202
Note - I have used different User Agent Value for each request.

Thanks
Narendra

@maxfeldman First of all thanks to you for re-opening this report
Now the api end point is proper rate limited and throwing me the error.
{"ok":false,"error":"ratelimited"}

BTW Its a very great fix.

Thanks
Narendra
